summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorneys representing alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein and a federal prosecutor. The emails discuss scheduling interviews for two clients and inquire about the status of the criminal investigation following Epstein's death. The attorneys also ask if their clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with a federal prosecutor to schedule interviews for clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She inquires about the investigation's status after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney representing alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She coordinates interview schedules for two clients with the prosecutor's office.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her interview with prosecutors.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier who is the subject of the criminal investigation (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The emails reference alleged assaults by him in 2004.

events.title: Initial Attorney Call with Prosecutor
events.description: Attorneys Teri Gibbs and Colleen Mullen spoke with a federal prosecutor regarding their clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: Scheduled in-person interview at the prosecutor's office for one alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]), to be accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: Scheduled video conference interview for a second alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) who is located in Japan.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein passed away in jail. The emails from August 12 inquire about the status of the criminal investigation following his death.

events.title: Alleged Assault by Epstein
events.description: The attorneys state their clients believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

keyFacts: The email chain is between victim attorneys and a federal prosecutor (AUSA) in the Southern District of New York regarding case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) against Jeffrey Epstein.
Two alleged victims are represented: one available for an in-person interview in New York on August 26, 2019, and another located in Japan available for a video conference.

The attorneys inquire about the status of the criminal investigation following Jeffrey Epstein's death in jail the prior weekend (August 10, 2019), noting interest in the investigation into potential co-conspirators.
The attorneys provided photographs of their clients from 2004 and asked prosecutors to confirm if their clients appear in any photographs seized from Epstein's home.
Multiple names of alleged victims and the prosecutor are redacted in the document text.
